image.altText: RSL Tasmania CEO John Hardy stands in front of the Hobart Cenotaph holding a football.

props.synopsis: Released emails have revealed a list of requests made by Tasmania's RSL to the state government, including a museum and the special naming of grandstands, as part of Hobart's proposed stadium development.Â

title.children: RSL wants 'recognition of service' before every event at proposed Hobart stadium

image.altText: a police badge

props.synopsis: Police arrest a 60-year-old man in Hobart over the alleged attempted abduction of a youth at the Queens Domain last night, after the alleged victim told police the vehicle's number plate.

title.children: Man charged with attempted abduction of young person in Hobart after alleged victim recounts number plate

image.altText: A spotted fish with a fan-like dorsal fin, flappy pectoral fins and six crab-like legs over sand in a fish tank.

props.synopsis: Imagine wading in the shallows at the beach and tasting mussels and clams hidden under the sand â€” with your feet. A new study shows fish species evolved to do just that.

title.children: Sea robins have 'the body of a fish, wings of a bird, legs of a crab'. They can also taste with their 'feet'

image.altText: Six puppy labradoodles in a cage

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC show that dogs surrendered from a labradoodle breeder in July were severely underweight, overbred, and some dogs with facial fur so extensive it impaired their sight were kept near electric fences.

title.children: Dogs stacked in shipping containers overnight without water â€” what vet report reveals about now-shutdown breeder

image.altText: Cars rush past a modern building fronted with opaque glass panels.

props.synopsis: Days after Tasmania's Liberal government cops flak over no funds being allocated to Launceston's promised heart centre in the state budget, Prime Minister Albanese announces the Federal government would foot the entire bill.

title.children: Federal government to foot entire bill for specialised heart centre in Tasmania's north

image.altText: A mother reading a book to her two children in bed

props.synopsis: As school attendance and attention wanes, teachers say small changes at home can make a big difference during school hours.

title.children: A bedtime routine can help with schooling. This is what a child psychologist does with her kids

image.altText: A man in a cap and waterproof clothes leaning in to look closely at moss growing on a tree trunk with a hand lens.

props.synopsis: Des Callaghan has travelled the world photographing mosses, and describes Tasmania as a "hotspot".

title.children: Tasmania is a hotspot for mosses, those 'overlooked botanical beauties'

image.altText: A soldier covers his ears as a tank explodes

props.synopsis: Israel has been giving strong signals it plans to launch a ground invasion of Lebanon as part of its war against Hezbollah, but whether it has learnt from its last military campaign in the country remains to be seen.

title.children: What Israel can learn from its 2006 ground invasion of Lebanon, which 'failed completely'

image.altText: A man with a wreath on his head stands on a podium with a medal

props.synopsis: A former captain of Australia's Olympic rowing team pinned his ex-wife down while wearing black rubber gloves and had her in "fear for her life" during an assault he has pleaded guilty to, a Tasmanian court has heard.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Former Olympic rower wore 'black rubber gloves' during assault of ex-wife, court told

image.altText: A suited man speaks at a press conference in front of the Israeli flag

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister made an outright rejection of calls for a ceasefire with Lebanon's Hezbollah, citing the safety of citizens in northern Israel.

title.children: Netanyahu arrives in New York for UN speech declaring Israel will continue fighting Hezbollah with 'full force'

image.altText: Woman grocery shopping in dairy aisle

props.synopsis: A new report from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has found many Australians have lost trust in supermarkets as it investigates the mega grocers' market power and potential barriers to entry in the sector.

title.children: The ACCC has released its interim report into supermarkets. Here's what it tells us

image.altText: A graphic showing a microscopic photo of the mpox virus and a red arrow

props.synopsis: Between July and September 26, the number of mpox cases increased by more than 570 per cent to a total of 724. One way to address to growing number of cases is increasing vaccination rates.

title.children: Mpox cases reaches record level in Australia, increasing by over 570 per cent since July

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Zheng Shanjie shake hands in front of a small table with the Chinese and Australian flags.

props.synopsis: Mr Chalmers is in Beijing to co-chair the first Australia-China Strategic Economic Dialogue in seven years, as well as to better understand the challenges facing the Chinese economy.

title.children: In Beijing for historic talks, Chalmers says China's economic growth is in Australia's interest

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: For many of us, COVID has become just a bad memory, despite its lasting and mixed legacies. But experts are urging that we learn from our mistakes and plan ahead.Â

title.children: COVID's long shadow looms as Albanese urged to lead on pandemic planning

image.altText: A man watching football having an angry reaction

props.synopsis: The AFL and NRL grand finals are a time of celebration for many, but experts warn it can be a period of heightened risk for domestic violence.

title.children: Footy, fans and family violence: Why experts say major sporting events are the 'perfect storm'

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton's heads in profile are aligned in the centre of the frame, Albanese scratching his neck.

props.synopsis: The whiplash-inducing negative gearing debate began with a morning story in the newspapers and ended with the Prime Minister using a report that was once used to attack Labor to defend his position.

title.children: The PM took the podium and dangled possible negative gearing changes, sparking a whiplash-inducing debate

image.altText: Daniel Ricciardo before practice, looking at the track, wearing a cap and team clothing

props.synopsis: Eight-time grand prix winner Daniel Ricciardo has been axed from his team RB, in what could be the end of his Formula 1 career.

title.children: Ricciardo officially dropped from F1 as rising Kiwi star takes his seat

image.altText: A man with a concerned look on his face

props.synopsis: Eric Adams vows to fight US prosecutors on a case alleging he accepted illegal campaign contributions and luxury travel from foreign nationals for many years.

title.children: New York Mayor Eric Adams charged in bribery and fraud scheme stretching back 10 years

image.altText: A graphic shows a food delivery app surrounded by a ghost-like haze.

props.synopsis: Have you noticed new dining options popping up on food delivery apps, but can't find their local shopfront? Chances are the food comes from a dark kitchen, also known as ghost or cloud kitchens.

title.children: COVID lockdowns 'fired a rocket' behind the ghost kitchen trend, but customers may not realise where their food is coming from

props.synopsis: High in the Chilean desert, the Extremely Large Telescope is taking shape. It promises sharper views of space than we've ever seen â€” but will Australian astronomers be able to use it?

title.children: 'We will not fail': The Extremely Large Telescope in Chile is astronomy's next big thing â€” if it works

image.altText: Head shot of ABC Editorial Director Alan Sunderland.

props.synopsis: A Walkley-winning journalist who spent 40 years working for SBS and the ABC will head an independent review into the 2022 reports, including a story that included an "editing error in the audio" of helmet cam footage captured by commandos in Afghanistan.Â

title.children: ABC appoints Alan Sunderland to conduct independent review into Line of Fire reporting

image.altText: LOST PARADISE

props.synopsis: The US ticket-selling platform Lyte has shut down, leaving two Australian music festivals in the lurch.Â

title.children: 'We are taking this situation seriously': Aussie festivals respond after US ticketing agent shuts down

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: A District Court jury has found independent Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell guilty of multiple theft and dishonesty offences after deliberating for two days.

title.children: Jury finds independent Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell guilty of theft and fraud

image.altText: A man and woman hugging at a ceremony, outside on a sunny day.

props.synopsis:
More than a year after three US marines were killed in an Osprey crash north of Darwin, the troops and their families have been honoured at a healing ceremony in Darwin.Â 

Â

title.children: US marines killed in Tiwi Islands Osprey crash honoured at emotional healing ceremony

image.altText: Two Chinese men in suits sit in chairs behind a desk

props.synopsis: China test-fired an intercontinental ballistic missile into the Pacific Ocean this week. Why the Pacific, and why now?Â

title.children: China has launched an intercontinental ballistic missile into the Pacific Ocean. Why the Pacific, and why now?

image.altText: Secret service pic

props.synopsis: A new report gives the most detailed timeline to date of how the Pennsylvania assassination attempt unfolded, revealing the shooter was on the roof for six minutes before he opened fire.

title.children: The FBI says the would-be Trump assassin 'climbed up an air conditioning unit' before opening fire

image.altText: Kaylee Mckeown after a swimming race, resting on the lane rope as she looks at the timing board

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown has carried on from where she left off at the Olympics, blasting to a short course world record in the 100m backstroke at the Australian Championships in Adelaide.

title.children: Not content with her Olympic success, Kaylee McKeown adds another world record to her name

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has said any negative gearing changes must not constrain housing supply, but has pointed to research which says housing would become more affordable.

title.children: PM cools on negative gearing over supply fears, but evidence tells a different story

image.altText: Darcy Fort training with the Brisbane Lions in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions name Darcy Fort in place of injured ruck Oscar McInerney for Saturday's grand final, while Taylor Adams fails in his bid to make the Swans' extended squad.

title.children: Lions confirm ruck replacement for grand final as Swans make call on Adams

image.altText: A composite image

props.synopsis: Righto then, smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Surprise Aria nods, Pesto the penguin, and a new Socceroos coach

image.altText: Kevvie Magic Round

props.synopsis: Broncos officials told Walters on Thursday that his tenure as coach was over, after months of speculation about his future.

title.children: Brisbane Broncos sack coach Kevin Walters after NRL grand finalists' stunning fall to 12th spot

image.altText: Two brown bear cubs lie by the side of a river. One rests its chin on the other's back.

props.synopsis: Fat Bear Week's warm-up bracket for the chubby cubbies of Alaska has kicked off. Here's what to know.

title.children: These portly bear cubs are vying for your vote as Fat Bear Junior returns

image.altText: Adam Driver in Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis

props.synopsis: For better or worse, Frances Ford Coppola's long-awaited passion project featuring a laundry list of high-profile actors has finally hit cinemas.

title.children: Megalopolis took more than 40 years and $120m to make. It's been worth every bit of trouble
